response.summary:
As an electrical engineer with over 7 years of experience in the Power Transformers market, I have developed a diverse skill set that encompasses leadership, customer relationship management, fast learning, inquisitive thinking, results orientation, negotiation and communication. I have excelled as a project manager, successfully coordinating multiple teams from Contract Management to Site Acceptance Testing.

With a proven track record of handling projects valued up to USD 25 million, I have worked on projects located across the USA and Canada mainly, ensuring successful outcomes. I possess a genuine interest in renewable energies and their potential for sustainable growth.
response.skills: Gestión de sistemas, Programación, Dirección de equipos, Experiencia del cliente, Control de calidad, Gestión de contratos, Gestión de relaciones con clientes (CRM), Coordinación de proyectos, Satisfacción del cliente, Negociación, Microsoft Excel, Liderazgo, Mercados energéticos, Mercados eléctricos, Planificación estratégica, Gestión de la calidad, Inglés, Teamwork, Investigación y desarrollo, Administración y dirección de empresas

profile_positions.description:
>	30+ projects of power transformers supply for utilities, oil & gas, and petrochemical customers 
        managed.
>	Managed power transformers rated up to 138 kV and 110 MVA.
>	Customer managed (among others): Shell, Bechtel Corporation, Black & Veatch, Technip 
        Energies, Kiewit Corporation, Sacramento Municipal Utility District, Oklahoma Gas & Electric, 
        Walden Green Energy, Ecopetrol S.A., Enel, ENMAX, Canadian Natural Resources Limited.
>	Mostly engaged with transformers for North American market, mainly for EPC companies.
>	Customer fronting during recurring progress meetings.
>	Effectively resources management during project execution for power transformers delivered in 
        Canada, USA, Guatemala, Costa Rica, Puerto Rico, Colombia, and Brazil.
>	Up to a 25 million USD project managed.
>	Cost controlling and profit recurring follow up.
>	Planning activities related to engineering phase, inspection, FAT, jobsite work and SAT.
>	Risk management and quality surveillance.
>	Promoting co-working between the different team workers.
>	Stakeholders’ engagement towards achievements.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
>	Supervision and customer service during testing of +300 power transformers: FAT and SAT under IEEE, IEC, CSA standards among others.
>	Warranty service and commissioning for power transformers delivered in Colombia, Ecuador, Guatemala, and USA.
>	Commissioning of monitoring equipment for transformers (ABB, EATON, General Electric, Qualitrol, SEL, SIEMENS, among others).
>	Functional testing of protocol communication IEC 61850 and DNP 3.0. on monitoring equipment.
profile_positions.title: Test Engineer

education.field_of_study: Administración y gestión de empresas, general

company.name: Siemens Energy
company.description:
Siemens Energy is one of the world’s leading energy technology companies. The company works with its customers and partners on energy systems for the future, thus supporting the transition to a more sustainable world. With its portfolio of products, solutions and services, Siemens Energy covers almost the entire energy value chain – from power generation and transmission to storage. The portfolio includes conventional and renewable energy technology, such as gas and steam turbines, hybrid power plants operated with hydrogen, and power generators and transformers. A majority stake in the wind power subsidiary Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy (SGRE) makes Siemens Energy a global market leader for renewable energies. An estimated one-sixth of the electricity generated worldwide is based on technologies from Siemens Energy. Siemens Energy employs 93,000 people worldwide in more than 90 countries and generated revenue of around €29 billion in fiscal year 2022.

Siemens Energy is a trademark licensed by Siemens AG
